text:
Hi guys I'm Dalia and I came all the way
from Dubai to Jamie's kitchen I'm super

excited to be here so I'm Syrian-German,
I'm a little bit confused about where

I'm from and so is my food but it's
really yummy really good and very very

healthy I'm gonna do an egg white omelet
with middle eastern flavors

so first things first we're going to separate our
egg whites from our yolks, so easy peasy I

love eggs we need about eight egg whites
beautiful there we go

so now we're going to whip up these egg
whites just to get some air in them they

don't need to be truth just a little bit
so, see? Nice and fluffy not too firm, now we're

going to add labneh, it's like a very thick
Greek yogurt it's strained it's

beautiful it's like really really tangy, I
love, I put this on everything on

meat on bread I can't live without this
stuff, so one and two, you know this recipe it's really easy you can

put as much or as little as you like I
love my labneh, so I put maybe a tad too much
but good stuff to add some more tang, sumac, so sumac is really really tangy it's a ground berry

and usually they ground it with a little
bit of sea salt so it's tangy and nicely

salted gorgeous stuff, on top of it
colors your food so if you do something
you can get a nice little red tint, natural food coloring you can put some salt

and pepper already in the egg white
mixture then second step is

frying up a little bit of onion it just
gives a little bit more flavor to the
omelette cos' egg whites can be a little bit bland, so olive oil put the onions in already, we don't want
the onions to brown we just want them to to soften up a little bit
the whole idea about this omelette is that it's white so if we brown and it gets all

crispy that's not what I want, I want it to look like a snow
white omelette with a bit of red, so parsley it's

really really good in this omelette so just a
little bit just to give it that parsley

kick and then spinach and now it looks
like a lot it won't be a lot, it's gonna

disappear into nothing,  so now it's time
to put the egg mixture in there, so grab your egg white, sumac, labneh

oh look at that, ok, now what you want to do is
kind of wiggle it around make sure it

goes everywhere but you just want it
good enough to be able to put it on your

plate, ok it's almost there now we need to flip
it over, now just wiggle it, wiggle it, wiggle wiggle and flip, there now
we're gonna add some more labneh just going to put a little bit in the center
maybe some here, and then we're gonna add a little bit more olive oil, just a little
So look at this guys, a beautiful wholesome omelette with a Middle Eastern twist, I can't wait to dig in

which I'm gonna do now but we're gonna do it the

I die for this bread so it's not

nice and thin, and then what you do with your

go in there you get a little bit of

Mm, sumac, spinach, labneh, tangy, good, yummy. Thanks so much for watching guys, if you like this recipe hit the subscribe button
